CLAUDE.md

Source: CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

Package Overview

spatialRF fits spatial random forest models by combining ranger with spatial predictors (Moran’s Eigenvector Maps, PCA-based, or distance matrix columns) to minimize residual autocorrelation and generate honest variable importance scores.

Main workflows: - rf(): Non-spatial random forest with spatial diagnostics (Moran’s I of residuals) - rf_spatial(): Spatial random forest with automatic spatial predictor generation/selection

Package limitations: Cannot predict on rasters, transfer models to different spatial structures, handle big data (>10k rows), do imputation/extrapolation, or account for temporal autocorrelation.

Citation: Always cite the ranger package when using spatialRF.

Package Ecosystem

spatialRF is part of a three-package ecosystem with shared design goals:

  • spatialRF: Spatial random forest modeling - main: rf(), rf_spatial()
  • collinear: Multicollinearity management - main: collinear() (docs, source)
  • distantia: Dissimilarity analysis - main: distantia() (docs, source)

Modern patterns in collinear/distantia (spatialRF is converging toward these): - Strict snake_case arguments (vs spatialRF’s current dot.notation) - Base R over tidyverse (minimal dependencies) - Dedicated validation helpers (validate_arg_*, utils_check_*) not inline validation - future backend for parallelization (vs spatialRF’s current foreach+doParallel) - progressr for progress reporting - NULL defaults with auto-detection - S3 classes with structured attributes - Ellipsis (...) for advanced arguments

Guidance: When making design decisions in spatialRF, check equivalent patterns in collinear and distantia to maintain ecosystem consistency. The modernization roadmap already aligns spatialRF with these patterns.

Development Status & Roadmap

Current phase: Maintenance (addressing breaking changes in dependencies)

Next phase (non-breaking): Backend modernization - Migrate foreach+doParallel → future+future.apply - Remove tidyverse dependencies (dplyr, tidyr, magrittr) → use base R - Replace %>% → |> (base pipe) - Delegate variable selection to collinear package - Replace @importFrom with explicit package::function()

Future (v2.0.0, breaking): API modernization - see vignettes/articles/development_roadmap.Rmd

Guidance for now: Prioritize stability and minimal changes. Avoid suggesting new tidyverse patterns or foreach loops (being phased out).

Core Architecture

Main Entry Points

  • rf(): Fits non-spatial random forest with diagnostics (R/rf.R)
  • rf_spatial(): Fits spatial random forest (R/rf_spatial.R)
  • rf_evaluate(): Spatial cross-validation (R/rf_evaluate.R)
  • rf_tuning(): Hyperparameter optimization (R/rf_tuning.R)
  • the_feature_engineer(): Suggests variable interactions (R/the_feature_engineer.R)

Spatial Predictor Generation (Three Methods)

  1. MEM (Moran’s Eigenvector Maps): mem() and mem_multithreshold() - eigenvectors of double-centered distance matrix weights
  2. PCA: pca() and pca_multithreshold() - principal components of weighted distance matrix (experimental)
  3. Hengl/RFsp: Uses distance matrix columns directly as predictors

Spatial Predictor Selection Pipeline

  1. Ranking (R/rank_spatial_predictors.R): By Moran’s I (“moran”) or by reduction in residual autocorrelation (“effect”)
  2. Selection: Sequential (add one-by-one) or recursive (re-rank after each addition, experimental)
  3. Optimization (R/optimization_function.R): Select minimal subset balancing Moran’s I reduction, R², and penalization for number of predictors

Model Structure

All models return ranger objects extended with: - ranger.arguments: Arguments used to fit the model - importance: Global importance df, plot, and local (per-observation) scores - performance: R², pseudo-R², RMSE, NRMSE - residuals: Values, normality test (residuals_diagnostics()), spatial autocorrelation (moran_multithreshold()) - spatial (spatial models only): Method, selected predictor names, optimization criteria, plots

Exported Functions (66 total)

Main: rf, rf_spatial, rf_evaluate, rf_tuning, rf_repeat, rf_compare, rf_importance, the_feature_engineer

**get_*:** get_evaluation, get_importance, get_importance_local, get_moran, get_performance, get_predictions, get_residuals, get_response_curves, get_spatial_predictors

**plot_*:** plot_evaluation, plot_importance, plot_moran, plot_optimization, plot_residuals_diagnostics, plot_response_curves, plot_response_surface, plot_training_df, plot_training_df_moran, plot_tuning

**print_*:** print_evaluation, print_importance, print_moran, print_performance

**auto_*:** auto_cor, auto_vif

Spatial predictors: mem, mem_multithreshold, moran, moran_multithreshold, pca, pca_multithreshold, rank_spatial_predictors, select_spatial_predictors_recursive, select_spatial_predictors_sequential, filter_spatial_predictors, optimization_function, prepare_importance_spatial

Cross-validation: make_spatial_fold, make_spatial_folds

Utilities: auc, case_weights, default_distance_thresholds, double_center_distance_matrix, is_binary, residuals_diagnostics, residuals_test, root_mean_squared_error, rescale_vector, thinning, thinning_til_n, weights_from_distance_matrix, objects_size, beowulf_cluster, setup_parallel_execution, standard_error, statistical_mode, .vif_to_df, %>%

Example Data

Standard datasets: plants_df, plants_response, plants_predictors, plants_distance, plants_xy, plants_rf, plants_rf_spatial

Development Commands

Testing

Tests are auto-generated from roxygen examples (pattern: test-{function}-examples.R). Modifying function examples affects tests.

devtools::test()                           # All tests
testthat::test_file("tests/testthat/...")  # Single test file
devtools::check()                          # R CMD check

CRAN checks: See dev_scripts/check_as_cran.R and dev_scripts/rhub.R

Documentation & Loading

devtools::document()              # Update roxygen docs
pkgdown::build_site()             # Build website
rmarkdown::render("README.Rmd")   # Rebuild README
devtools::load_all()              # Load for development

Development Agents

roxy: Reviews roxygen2 documentation for grammatical correctness and accuracy - Use after writing/modifying function documentation - Catches documentation issues before devtools::check()

crancop: Verifies CRAN policy compliance and prepares package for submission - Use before CRAN releases - Addresses reviewer feedback - Performs comprehensive compliance checks

Coding Style

  1. Use snake_case consistently — All functions, arguments, and internal variables use snake_case. No mixing with camelCase or dot.separation.

  2. Organize functions into prefix-based families — Group related functions under common prefixes that reflect their purpose (data_*, plot_*, get_*, print_*). Users discover functionality through autocomplete.

  3. Provide a main entry point with accessible internals — rf() and rf_spatial() handle typical workflows; individual steps (mem(), moran(), rank_spatial_predictors(), etc.) are exported separately for advanced users.

  4. Maintain consistent parameter names across functions — When multiple functions share a concept, use identical argument names everywhere:

    • data, dependent.variable.name, predictor.variable.names
    • distance.matrix, distance.thresholds
    • ranger.arguments (named list accepting both ranger args and package-specific args)
    • n.cores, cluster, seed, verbose

  5. Delegate parallelization to doParallel — Use foreach + %dopar% with socket clusters created via parallel::makeCluster(). The cluster parameter is passed through the model object to downstream functions. Stop clusters with parallel::stopCluster() only when user-provided (not when created internally).

  6. Use standard R data structures for input and output — Accept data frames (not tibbles), return ranger objects extended with lists. No custom S4/R6 classes.

Data Requirements & Common Validations

  • Format: data.frame only (tibbles not fully supported)
  • Size: 100 to ~10,000 rows
  • Response: Quantitative; binary (0/1) partially supported; factors not supported
  • distance.matrix rows must equal data rows (common error source)
  • No NA, zero-variance columns, or NaN/Inf when scaled

Key Implementation Patterns

  • ranger.arguments: Accepts both ranger args (num.trees, mtry) and package args (data, dependent.variable.name) in same list
  • scaled.importance = TRUE: Fits second model on scale(data) for comparable importance scores across units
  • Binary responses: Auto-balances via case_weights() passed to ranger’s case.weights
  • Spatial cross-validation: rf_evaluate() uses make_spatial_folds() with spatial thinning for independence

Workflow Principles

  1. Lead with code, follow with explanation — Code first, brief explanations, no preambles.
  2. Match technical level — Assume R package development familiarity.
  3. Preserve architecture — Follow established patterns, don’t refactor unrelated code.
  4. Always run devtools::check() and testthat — Flag test failures immediately.
